Aug 27, 2016

The JC 2016 College Football Preview

Hello Gang,

I love College Football. It is no secret to any one that happens to know me. I think that it is the greatest season of any sport at any level. Are there other aspects of sports that are better? Sure, nothing can beat the Opening Day of MLB, the Thursday-Sunday of opening weekend in March Madness, the nerves of Overtime Playoff Hockey, the level of skill and top notch football of the NFL Divisional Rounds, a Sunday at Augusta or the countdown of the Crowd during the Royal Rumble (yes I referenced WWE. Deal with it). College Football is the only one that delivers the goods from Start to Finish (Or Start to October if you are a Purdue fan)

Things I love about College Football: The Triple Option, Rivalry Games that mean something, Walk-Ons (and the videos are always great of the ones that get scholarships), Crooks and Crooked Programs (great to hate on), Tailgating, Regional Pride, Live Animal Mascots, Mascots (even if they are scary looking Willy Wildcat), Trick Plays, Marching Bands and Drumlines, How a great win can make your work week seem like nothing, how a bad loss makes you depressed the entire following week, Dotting the i, Running Down the Hill, Enter Sandman, entering the stadium on a Horse and throwing a Flaming Spear into the Ground!, Big Ten Rivalry Trophies, the clock stopping for a first down, Coaches having to do some strange stuff for recruiting or appeasing the fanbase, Touching the Banner, the Fight Songs, the Bragging Rights, and having a whole day of relaxing on the couch and not feeling one bit guilty about it.

So, now that I referenced why I am such a fan of the game I am going to offer my completely biased (and probably wrong) preview of the College Football Season. If you wanted stats and such, go to a real publication that probably costs some money, this is entirely on hunch and history.

If you have ever been around me long enough, you have probably heard me rant and rave about how every decision leads back to money & power (or trying to pick up a guy or girl but that doesn’t apply for College Football). I do really believe that is the case and why I do not expect there to be multiple teams from the same conference in the College Football Playoff. So in order to determine the CFB Playoff Contenders I think that we need to go conference by conference.

When evaluating things in CFB I always ask myself the following questions:

  • Do you trust the Coach?
  • Do you trust the QB?
  • Does the team try to play defense?
  • What is the schedule like? (Although don’t fall in love with a team just because they play a crappy schedule. It never works out. Never)

If you can check all of those boxes, well you got yourself a real contender on your hands. I am not going through every team, but teams that I feel have a reasonable shot at the playoff

The Big Ten

Contenders: Ohio State, Michigan, Michigan State, Iowa, (Wisconsin)

How I see it playing out: Ohio State loses to Oklahoma and Michigan State loses to Notre Dame starting the Rabble Rabble Rabble of ESPNers to talk about how the B1G is no good and a ton of other nonsense. Michigan rolls through a weak non conference schedule and is tested by Iowa, but goes undefeated in the first 11 games.

Methinks that Ohio State rights the ship and runs the table leading to the UM game. In a not so bold prediction the winner of the UM v. Ohio State game wins the B1G East and ultimately the B1G and ultimately will find themselves in the CFB playoff. Ohio state gets the edge due to the venue

Michigan State is listed here because Dantonio is a great coach and they get the two big boys at home. I don’t see it though. The D has regressed and I see them losing 4 or 5.

Iowa is the best of the West. Solid Coach, Solid QB, and manageable schedule.

Wisconsin is a fringe contender because they have been the same team for about the past decade. OLine with experience, quality RB, shaky QB, and always end up with 9 or 10 wins.

Other Bullets

  • Indiana remains the most entertaining team in CFB with a great O and non existant D and go 6–6.
  • Maryland makes a Bowl Game
  • Minnesota wins 8 games
  • Purdue comes in last again

Ohio State over Iowa in the B1G. Ohio State makes CFB Playoff. Michigan gets in if catastrophe in other conferences

The SEC

Contenders: Alabama, LSU, Georgia, Tennessee, Florida

I am not buying Tennessee. I have seen the Tennessee movie before. Loads of talent, fanbase ready for the breakout year and surrounding national hype, and it typically all blows up as soon as Florida whacks em. In an upset, I actually think that UT beats them this year, however the following part of the schedule is at UGA, at A&M, home v. Alabama. Unfortunately it is too early for A&M to be in their annual freefall and that smells like 0–3 or 1–2 to me.

I am not buying Ole Miss. Hugh Freeze is a crook. Its almost time for the chickens to come home to roost.

Alabama and LSU are both loaded with NFL talent and top notch Head Coaches. The game is at LSU so that will probably give them an advantage. Alabama will probably be playing with a QB so that will probably give them an advantage.

I don’t think Florida has enough offense.

Just like in the Big Ten, the winner of the LSU/Alabama game wins the SEC.

Alabama over Georgia in the SEC Title Game. Alabama in the CFB Playoff. LSU gets in if catastrophe in other conferences.

The Big 12

Contenders: Oklahoma, TCU, Oklahoma State

Every single year it is hyped about how great all of the Offenses and Quarterbacks are in this conference. When push comes to shove though in the big bowl games or CFB playoff, it is exposed again that it is a lack of defense, and not actually great offense. (Quick, name some NFL QBs that come from this era of Big 12 Offensive football…. yup, Sam Bradford then who…. my point)

Texas and Oklahoma at least are trying to play defense, TCU used to, the rest I am not so sure about.

I don’t like watching Big 12 football so I have no clue about this conference and really the intricacies.

Quick Hitters

  • I don’t think Baylor keeps it together and it starts the descent into bad football again. (See John L. Smith at Arkansas or Luke Fickell at Ohio State)
  • Kansas wont make a bowl (“The Curse of Charlie Weis”)
  • Kliff Kingsbury is the best looking coach in the Big 12 and has been ever since Charlie Weis left Kansas

The Pac-12

The Contenders: Stanford, Oregon, Washington, USC, UCLA

I feel bad for USC. I don’t think that Alabama could navigate that schedule without losing two games (Alabama playing Alabama?). I think they are a quality team but that is absolutely brutal.

What about UCLA? Do you think they will make the playoffs? Well lets ask Coach Jim Mora!

(Whoops, wrong Jim Mora, but no I do not trust Jim Mora at all to get UCLA to the playoffs. In fact I think A&M beats them week 1)

I think people are quick to crown Washington and quick to slam Oregon so far. Oregon finishes ahead of Washington. Both finish behind Stanford

Stanford beats UCLA (again) in the Pac-12 title game. Stanford makes the playoff if they beat ND or if ND loses 2.

ACC

Contenders: Florida State, Clemson, Louisville, North Carolina, Miami

Partially because I am lazy and partially because it is true, this conference comes down to one game, FSU v. Clemson. At this point, I trust Watson over whatever the Seminoles will put out there. Clemson outplayed Alabama last year save for Special Teams and busted assignments in the 2015 title game. (Those count JC, you cant Cherrypick) Yes I can.

The winner of Clemson v. FSU will win the ACC. I have Clemson over Miami in the ACC title game and Clemson making the College Football Playoff

Others

Notre Dame: ND has a manageable schedule, a competent QB (it will be Kizer) a great offensive mind…. but the defense lost 3 guys to first four rounds of the NFL Draft and I am expected to believe they are going to get better? The scheme has led to busted plays and I am gonna bet it happens again. Texas, USC, Stanford, Miami, and MSU are all games where they could trip up, plus there is always the one game that defies logic, I just don’t know which game it is. (South Florida lightning game, Tulsa going for the passing TD, the USC “Crazy Train Game” where they fumbled snaps, Northwestern going for 2, Cant find a holder, Pick Play, etc)

Houston: Will lose one game and be cooked. Sorry Houston, although I hope you get in the Big 12.

Navy: Don’t Give Up The Ship!

ULTIMATELY

  • Clemson, Alabama, Ohio State, Stanford is my CFB playoff. Michigan, Notre Dame, Florida State and LSU are in my next tier. Lets go with Ohio State over Alabama in the CFB title game.
  • Frisky teams that I like to be better than what people expect: Wisconsin, Pittsburgh, Miami, Western Michigan, Utah, Navy
  • Overrated Teams: Oklahoma, Ole Miss, Oklahoma State, Baylor, UCLA, USC
  • Western Michigan beats one or both of the Illinois B1G Teams
  • The MAC will remain the best weeknight TV
  • There will be 3 D-1AA teams to beat D1A teams
  • ESPN will make me mad while talking about the playoff rankings
  • I can’t wait for next Saturday! (Thursday)

What say you gang?

Until next time,

JC
